alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 5:25PM CDT until July 14 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Labette County in southeastern Kansas... Southeastern Cowley County in south central Kansas... Southern Neosho County in southeastern Kansas... Montgomery County in southeastern Kansas... Chautauqua County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 525 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Altoona to 6 miles south of Longton to near Arkansas City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Oswego, Erie, Chetopa, Sedan, Altamont, St. Paul, Cedar Vale, Thayer, Edna, Dearing, Altoona, Mound Valley and Elk City. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Cowley; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson
